doc.title: La batalla de Chile: La lucha de un pueblo sin armas - Tercera parte: El poder popular
doc.plot: Completed two years after _Batalla de Chile: La insurrección de la burguesía, La (1975)_ (qv) and _Batalla de Chile: El golpe de estado, La (1977)_ (qv), this film deals with the creation of thousands of local groups of "popular power" by ordinary workers and peasants to distribute food; occupy, guard, and run factories and farms; oppose black-market profiteering; and link together neighborhood social service organizations, first as a defense against strikes and lockouts by factory owners, tradesmen, and professional bodies opposed to the Allende government, and then increasingly as Soviet-type bodies demanding more resolute action by the government against the right.
